messages.subject: Homeopahty, broken bones and kids' behaviour
messages.msgSnippet: Yol, Thanks! I am way behind with this list.  I actually noticed the description at a Boiron display . As to to your recommending homeopathy to Shyrley I have
messages.messageBody:
Yol,

Thanks!

I am way behind with this list. I actually noticed the description
at a Boiron display .

As to to your recommending homeopathy to Shyrley I have to say

HEAR! HEAR!

Homeopathy has really changed our lives and absolutely enhanced our
quality of life. If I ever go back to school, it would be to become a
certified homeopath.

Best,
Liza



At 6:04 PM -0500 12/14/02, Yol, Vishnu & Shanti wrote:
>Hi Liza,
>
>You mean the proving symptoms? You'll have to read them on a Materia
>Medica. It's not a big remedy, but one of its main features is that
>it helps speed up the healing process of broken bones and other
>injuries (periosteum, cartilages, etc.).
>
>Regards,
>
>Yol
>
>
>Liza Sabater wrote:
>
>>What's the proving for Symphytum? Liza At 9:58 AM -0500 12/13/02,
>>Yol, Vishnu & Shanti wrote:
>>
>>>Dar,
>>>
>>>Go to the health food store and get homeopathic Arnica 30X (or
>>>30c) and Symphytum 30X (or 30c). If it's inflammed and feels
>>>bruised, give the arnica (two pellets) every couple hour until it
>>>feels better. Try to avoid any other painkillers. If if's too
>>>painful, give the arnica more frequently. Then you can give the
>>>symphytum (two pellets) twice a day for a few days, to speed up
>>>the process of healing.
>>>
>>>If you can't find the symphytum, give her comfrey tea, or email me
>>>if you have any questions.
>>>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
